author: raul.campos@razon.com.mx (Raúl Campos)
title: ¡Se sabe la de chambear ! Pedro Moreno, actor de Televisa, cambia la actuación por ser albañil
text:
Se puso más papucho
¡Se sabe la de chambear ! Pedro Moreno, actor de Televisa, cambia la actuación por ser albañil
El actor Pedro Moreno cambió la actuación por ser albañil; así de bien le va al famoso
Todos los fans de las telenovelas no pueden creer lo que ha pasado con un querido actor de Televisa, pues Pedro Moreno, conocido su trabajo en melodramas y salir en MasterChef Celebrity, impactó a todos demostrando que él sí se sabe la de chambear, pues se convirtió en albañil y le va de maravilla.
En entrevista con el programa Hoy, Pedro Moreno, quien es cubano, reveló que decidió convertirse en albañil allá en Estados Unidos para demostrar que no sólo es una cara bonita y remarcó además
que le va ridículamente bien.
Asimismo, Pedro Moreno dijo que en un futuro quiere hacer un programa dedicado a temas de construcción, de la cual dijo que es “un arte hermoso”, pues es su pasión y quiere terminar con todas las connotaciones negativas que se tienen respecto a los albañiles.
"La gente tiene un error de concepción de lo que es la construcción, la construcción es algo hermoso, es algo que tú haces, fabricas y se queda ahí, es una estructura que cambia la geografía, así sea una casa, una pared o lo que construyas, es el resultado de un esfuerzo,
un análisis, unos cálculos", dijo a Hoy.
Por si fuera poco, Pedro Moreno añadió que su incursión en la construcción ha podido ha adquirido propiedades y que actualmente se
encuentra desarrollando 15 casas en Lehigh, Florida.
Y, para fortuna de sus fans, Pedro Moreno remarcó que no va a dejar la actuación, pues este año formará parte de una nueva producción de Televisa llamada 'Tu vida es mi vida', la cual se estrena el próximo 15 de enero de 2024.
Finalmente, remarcó que su trabajo en la albañilería y la construcción no interferirá con su carrera actoral, por lo que sus fans seguirán disfrutando de él en la tv.

author: Anthony Robledo
title: Viral photo of forlorn Spiral Hot Dogs owner leads to booming business
text: Customer's photo of forlorn owner in empty restaurant leads business to boom at OK diner Nick Chappell had never been to Spirals Hot Dogs & More before he took a photo of Scott Hosek in his empty restaurant. But after business boomed, Chappell's part of the Spirals family, Hosek says. [Anthony Robledo](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7612431001/anthony-robledo/) An Oklahoma hot dog joint owner visibly wanted customers one day and he soon got more than he bargained for. During a slow shift on Dec. 20, a customer took a photo of Scott Hosek standing by his restaurant entrance waiting for diners and shared it on social media. Hosek would soon have no time to stand around as " [Spirals: Hot Dogs & More](https://spiralshotdogs.com/)," in Norman, Oklahoma, saw booming business once the post went viral. "We immediately started doing double digits in sales," Hosek told USA TODAY on Thursday. "It happened really fast to me." The day the photo was taken, Hosek found himself staring out the window upset his family business of four years wasn't booming as well as others ahead of Christmas. Hosek said he had no idea why Spirals saw a sudden wave of new customers after Dec. 20 until the person responsible for posting the photo, Nick Chappell, later apologized and offered to take the post down. Hosek wouldn't hear of it. "You just wouldn't expect it. Social media is amazing. It's amazing that people get involved with it," he said. "But more importantly, it's the stuff that you just don't think would work. That's what works." 'I will always love you': [See Dolly Parton grant Utah man's dying wish to meet her](/story/life/humankind/2023/12/26/dolly-parton-meets-longtime-fan/72033945007/) Customer knew he had to capture 'wholesome moment' Chappell visited the Norman area for his job as an Oklahoma Army National Guard. As part of their weekly hot dog Wednesday routine, Chappell and a his co-worker found Spirals on Google Maps and took a chance. Noticing Hosek gazing, Chappell decided to capture the "wholesome moment" on Snapchat captioning "He has been standing here waiting on customers to come in." "A good buddy of mine named Chad said, 'Hey, man, you can either post this on Facebook or I'm going to post this on Facebook. Some way or another we're going to get this guy some customers,'" Chappell said. In a Facebook post, Chappell gave an excellent recommendation of the restaurant, complimenting their food and "off the charts" service. He shared a photo of his dish, the menu and of Hosek waiting for diners. Chappell was blown away by the success of the post, which has since had over 2,000 shares, and even more surprised to see over 70 guests at the diner during his next visit. "I'm not a huge social media guy I typically don't share," Chappell said. "I don't even know really the words to describe it as but it made me even that much happier that I did make a post." Owner adds new 'Thunderbird' item in customer's honor Hosek is showing his gratitude by adding a new item in Chappell's honor. Having named hot dogs and bowls after family members, he was more than happy to do so. The "Thunderbird" is a hot link with bacon, cream cheese and jalapeños, Hosek said. The meal gets its name from the Thunderbird Unit Patch for the 45th Infantry, which Chappell is a part of. The two reconnected at the restaurant on Thursday, where they both got emotional talking about the post's impact. Chappell received a certificate of appreciation during the unveiling of the "Thunderbird" and was told he is now forever part of the Spirals family. "To know that it was a humble guy that just saw our need and did what he could. He doesn’t have a real following on social media, he hardly ever shares anything and to know that one post had so much power. It was super cool," Hosek added.

author: Anonym
title: Parish reopens a church and stops a new slot room - News - The Limited Times
text:
The reopening of a small church, still consecrated but unused for years, could stop the opening of a new slot room in Faenza (Ravenna). The parish of San Marco, as reported by the Corriere di Romagna, has in fact announced in recent weeks that it has reopened the small chapel of San Rocco, owned by the ASP, for worship, thanks to a loan for use, for the holding of parties, moments of meeting and prayer. A small initiative, but one that could have an immediate effect: the land where gambling should be started now falls within a radius of 500 meters, considered a "sensitive zone", where, by law, it is forbidden to open activities of this type. The opening of the slot room, which had already received favorable opinion from the municipality, has been at the center of controversy in the neighborhood for months, with a petition by residents to stop it that has collected hundreds of signatures. The parish's move has now changed the cards on the table, the issue will have to be investigated by the legal departments, but the opening is much more complicated at this point. "We," the parish priest Fr. Davide Ferrini told the newspaper, "had been thinking for some time to reopen the chapel to organize moments of prayer or exhibitions. Certainly gambling is a serious problem, I don't know how much the opening of a church can affect this, but it can push someone to reflect."

author: Reuters
title: Sudan's RSF paramilitaries welcome UN call for cessation of hostilities in Ramadan
text: CAIRO (Reuters) - Sudan's Rapid Support Forces (RSF) paramilitary group on Saturday welcomed a call by the United Nations Security Council for a cessation of hostilities in the Muslim holy month of Ramadan, offering a potential respite from the 11-month-old conflict. Ramadan is expected to start on Sunday evening. In a statement, the RSF expressed hope that the Security Council resolution would "significantly lessen the suffering of the Sudanese people by ensuring the smooth delivery of humanitarian aid" and pave the way for a political process leading to a permanent ceasefire. War erupted in Sudan on April 15, 2023, between the Sudanese army and the RSF. The U.N. says nearly 25 million people - half Sudan's population - need aid, some 8 million have fled their homes and hunger is rising. Washington says the warring parties have committed war crimes. On Friday, the Security Council adopted a British-drafted resolution for a cessation of hostilities in Ramadan with 14 votes in favour, while Russia abstained. However, the mechanism for implementing the resolution remains unclear. Sudan's U.N. ambassador, Al-Harith Idriss Al-Harith Mohamed, told the council on Thursday that the president of the country's transitional council commended the appeal of U.N. Secretary-General Antonio Guterres for a Ramadan truce. However, he said the leader is "wondering about how to do this." "In embracing the proposed humanitarian ceasefire, we express our readiness to partake in discussions concerning the establishment of mutually agreed upon monitoring mechanisms," the RSF said in its Saturday statement. "These mechanisms are crucial for ensuring the effective implementation of the ceasefire and for achieving the humanitarian objectives intended by this resolution." (Reporting by Hatem Maher and Ahmed Tolba; Editing by Andrew Heavens and Giles Elgood)

author: Cynthia Valdez
title: Jacqie Rivera y Mike Campos se divorcian tras 12 años de matrimonio
text:
La historia de amor entre Jacqie Rivera y Mike Campos llegó a su fin luego de 12 años juntos. Los rumores de la crisis en pareja empezaban a sonar desde días atrás, y ha sido la mañana de este jueves que, a través de Despierta América, se confirmara que la pareja ha decidido tomar caminos separados. En el matutino de Univision se mostraron los documentos legales con los que la pareja estaría buscando por vía oficial dar por terminada su relación de marido y mujer. "Ahora sí parece que esta separación es definitiva. Jacqie ha puesto punto final a esta relación", dijo Karla Martínez en uno de los segmentos del show.
Si bien la pareja habría tenido altas y bajas a lo largo de su matrimonio, lo solucionaban como suele pasar en la convivencia cotidiana. Pero, esta vez, la reconciliación no parece ser una opción para ellos, tal como abría sucedido en 2018, cuando anunciaron su separación, pero meses después volvían a estar juntos y con un bebé en camino. Cabe resaltar que en ese entonces o hubo una acción legal como la que ya se encuentra en los juzgados.
La lucha por su amor
Durante su matrimonio, Jacqie Rivera y Mike Campos no estuvieron ajenos a la polémica, pero también hicieron mucho por mantener la relación a flote, como en septiembre de 2023, cuando renovaron sus votos, organizando una gran fiesta en la que estuvieron acompañados por sus familiares, amigos y seres más queridos; entre ellos Rosie Rivera, quien fuera mamá de la fallecida Jenni, y abuela de Jacqie.
Según reporta el medio, la pareja habría estado haciendo una vida separada desde el año pasado. los desacuerdos como pareja y las agendas laborales habrían sido el detonante de la separación, además de los problemas que llevaban en mente desde años atrás. Por el momento, ninguna de las partes ha hecho comentarios al respecto.
